ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An identifier is a string suitable for identifying some product data.
An identifier may or may not have a natural-language meaning.
In the context of a product, a part number or serial number would be an example of an identifier.

A label is an alphanumeric string that represents the human-interpretable name of something and shall have a natural-language meaning.
'Smith', 'Widget Inc.', and 'Materials Test Laboratory' are examples of labels.
A text is an alphanumeric string intended to be read and understood by a human being. It is for information purposes only.

The bag_to_set function converts BAGs into SETs.
This function can be used to convert the BAGs returned by the USEDIN function into SETs.
(input) the BAG that is to be converted into a SET.

The type_check_function function compares the names of the data types of the instance that is referred to by the parameter the_type with the set of entity names specified by sub_names.
Depending on the value of criterion, it returns TRUE if:
case 0: the intersection of the two aggregates is not empty.
If sub_names contains the entity names of all the subtypes of a particular entity data type, this case can be used to ensure that no instance of the supertype exists.
case 1: the intersection of the two aggregates is empty.
If sub_names contains the entity names of subtypes of a particular entity data type, this function can be used to ensure that no instance of these subtypes exists.
case 2: the intersection of the two aggregates contains exactly one name.
If sub_names contains the entity names of all the subtypes of a particular entity data type, this function can be used to ensure that no complex entity instance of subtypes of the entity exists and that only instances of subtypes of the entity exist.
The concept of complex entity instance is defined in ISO 10303-11.
case 3: the intersection of the two aggregates contains at most one name.
If sub_names contains the entity names of subtypes of a particular entity data type, this function can be used to ensure that no complex entity instance of these subtypes of the entity exists.
(input) the instance whose data type is checked.
(input) the set of names of the entity data types that are candidates for the type of the_type.
the integer number value between 0 and 3.
